author: cbc
title: 3 dead in Brampton house fire, 1 girl taken to hospital with serious burns

organizations.name: office of the ontario fire marshal

text:
Three people have died and a child was seriously injured in an overnight house fire in Brampton, Ont.
Peel Regional Police were called shortly after 4 a.m. about a fire at the townhouse on Madison Street, near Dixie Road and Bovaird Drive East.
Police said a young girl was also taken to the Hospital for Sick Children with third-degree burns and smoke inhalation.
"It's tragic, certainly — the number of people who have died here," said Brampton fire Chief Michael Clark, who was at the scene Tuesday morning.

Fire is under control at Madison St.
All crews remain committed ^pb pic.twitter.com/pTc5ilaqAu 
— @BramptonFireES The fire started on the main floor. It took fire crews about 10 minutes to get it under control, Clark said.
"I'm told there was a basement tenant who went upstairs and rescued the young female," he said.

#PRP onscene of serious house fire on Madison St, B. Fire contained to one unit, area shut down. Media officers heading to scene. Avoid area pic.twitter.com/tMms3QThd2 
— @PeelPoliceMedia Clark added the relationship between the three people who died and the young girl isn't clear.
Emergency services remained at the scene of the fire Tuesday morning, and are awaiting the arrival of the coroner and someone from the Office of the Ontario Fire Marshal.
Flames broke out on the main floor of the town house in Brampton early this morning. (Linda Ward/CBC)
People in the neighbouring townhouses are safe, police said.
The cause of the fire is being investigated.

With files from Linda Ward
